1.text: And Elihu will add and say,

2.text: Wait for me a little, and I will show thee, for yet words for God.

3.text: I will lift up my knowledge from far off, and to him making me, I will give justice.

4.text: For truly my words are not falsehood: the perfect of knowledge with thee.

5.text: Behold, God is mighty, and he will not despise: mighty in strength of heart.

6.text: He will not save alive the unjust one, and he will give the judgment of the poor.

7.text: He will not take off his eyes from the just: and with kings upon the throne, and he will seat them for glory, and they shall be exalted.

8.text: And they being bound in fetters shall be taken in the cords of affliction.

9.text: And he will announce to them their work, and their transgressions, for they will be strong.

10.text: And he will uncover their ear for instruction, and he will say that they shall turn back from iniquity.

11.text: If they will hear and will serve him, they shall finish their days in good, and their years in delights.

12.text: And if they will not hear, they shall pass away by the spear, and they shall expire without knowledge.

13.text: And the profane of heart shall set up anger: they will not cry if he bound them.

14.text: Their soul will die in youth, and their life among the consecrated.

15.text: He will deliver the poor one in his affliction, and he will uncover their ear in oppression.

16.text: And also he moved thee from the mouth of the enemy to a broad, not straight place; and thy table came down full of fatness.

17.text: And thou didst fill up the judgment of the unjust one; judgment and right shall hold together.

18.text: Because of wrath, lest he shall remove thee with smiting, and a multitude of covering shall not turn thee away.

19.text: Will he value thy riches? not gold and all the powers of thy strength.

20.text: Thou shalt not pant after the night, for taking up peoples in their place.

21.text: Watch thyself; thou shalt not turn to iniquity: for upon this thou didst choose rather than affliction.

22.text: Behold, God will exalt by his power: who teaches like him?

23.text: Who charged upon him his way? and who said, Thou didst iniquity?

24.text: Remember that thou shalt magnify his work which men beheld.

25.text: Every man looked upon it; man shall see from far off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, and we shall not know the number of his years, and it was not searched out.

27.text: For he will withhold the drops of water: they will pour out rain for its vapor.

28.text: Which the clouds will shake out; they will drop an abundance upon man.

29.text: Also if he shall understand the spreadings of the cloud, the noise of his booth.

30.text: Behold, he spread upon it his light, and he covered the roots of the sea.

31.text: For by them he will judge the peoples; he will give food to abundance.

32.text: With the hands be covered the light; and he commanded concerning it with a mark.

33.text: His thunder will announce concerning him, and the flock also concerning the going up.
